Events that occurred on 1 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1914 - Donald A. Wollheim is born.
1924 - J.R.R. Tolkien begins his Professorship of English Language at the University of Leeds.
1941 - Author Glen GoodKnight is born.
1969 - Actor Charles Edwards is born.
1976 - Oxonmoot 1976 at The Welsh Pony.
1979 - The Jackanory episode "An Unexpected Party" is aired on the BBC.
1999 - Voice actor Noel Johnson dies.
2003 - The Gospel According to Tolkien is published.
2007 - The second and expanded edition of Tolkien On Fairy-stories is published.
2007 – The redesigned slipcased edition of Mr. Bliss is published.
2010 - Middle-earth: Visions of a Modern Myth is published.
2010 - Jubilee for Mithlond, the Gothenburg Tolkien Society of Sweden.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Together with Strider the four hobbits travel towards Weathertop.
Gandalf leaves Bree.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
Full moon[1]

content.content: ↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. l
